nationality.content:
Please examine the provided paragraph and extract the nationalities of the people mentioned in the paragraph.

Paragraph:  Except for sociopaths , humans are built to feel and act out of empathy , said Stephen G. Post , a professor of bioethics at Case Western Reserve University 's medical school and co-author of '' Why Good Things Happen to Good People , '' scheduled to be published in May . 

Let's think step by step.

1. Stephen G. Post - No specific nationality is mentioned in the paragraph.
2. Case Western Reserve University - This is a university located in Cleveland, Ohio, USA. Therefore, Stephen G. Post is likely to be an American. However, the paragraph does not explicitly mention his nationality.
3. The co-author of the book "Why Good Things Happen to Good People" is also not explicitly mentioned to be of any specific nationality.

Therefore, based on the information provided in the paragraph, we can only confidently extract one nationality, which is American for Stephen G. Post, who is associated with an American university. The nationalities of the other individuals mentioned in the paragraph are not explicitly stated.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Person', 'Nationality', 'Whether the Person has the Nationality']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

| Person | Nationality | Whether the Person has the Nationality |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Stephen G. Post | American | Yes |
| Co-author of "Why Good Things Happen to Good People" | Not specified | No |
| Case Western Reserve University | American | Yes |
| Humans | Not specified | No |
| Sociopaths | Not specified | No |
